### rpmalloc&#95;dump&#95;statistics() {#a3c33a5925ba558f8dc534c668e344db1}

<Link id="l00062" /><CodeLine lineNumber="62"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  Will introduce a very small overhead to track fully allocated spans in heaps</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00063" /><CodeLine lineNumber="63"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#ifndef RPMALLOC&#95;FIRST&#95;CLASS&#95;HEAPS</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00064" /><CodeLine lineNumber="64" lineLink="#aa20456aea27df9da3c00efecb1dba3b4"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#define RPMALLOC&#95;FIRST&#95;CLASS&#95;HEAPS 0</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00065" /><CodeLine lineNumber="65"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#endif</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00066" /><CodeLine lineNumber="66"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00067" /><CodeLine lineNumber="67"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//! Flag to rpaligned&#95;realloc to not preserve content in reallocation</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00068" /><CodeLine lineNumber="68" lineLink="#affda05352198b9ef86d42be851a1349f"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#define RPMALLOC&#95;NO&#95;PRESERVE 1</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00069" /><CodeLine lineNumber="69"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//! Flag to rpaligned&#95;realloc to fail and return null pointer if grow cannot be</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00070" /><CodeLine lineNumber="70"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//! done in-place,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00071" /><CodeLine lineNumber="71"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  in which case the original pointer is still valid (just like a call to</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00072" /><CodeLine lineNumber="72"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  realloc which failes to allocate a new block).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00073" /><CodeLine lineNumber="73" lineLink="#ab3774a093749aeca1d4e387b11e79395"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#define RPMALLOC&#95;GROW&#95;OR&#95;FAIL 2</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00074" /><CodeLine lineNumber="74"></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00154" /><CodeLine lineNumber="154" lineLink="#aaef706ac2be95d5a4f00bfab78128234"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#125; <a href="/docs/api/structs/rpmalloc-thread-statistics-t">rpmalloc&#95;thread&#95;statistics&#95;t</a>;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00155" /><CodeLine lineNumber="155"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00156" /><CodeLine lineNumber="156" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/rpmalloc-config-t"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">typedef</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">struct </span><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/structs/rpmalloc-config-t">rpmalloc&#95;config&#95;t</a> &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00157" /><CodeLine lineNumber="157"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  //! Map memory pages for the given number of bytes. The returned address MUST</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00158" /><CodeLine lineNumber="158"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  //! be</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00159" /><CodeLine lineNumber="159"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  aligned to the rpmalloc span size, which will always be a power of two.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00160" /><CodeLine lineNumber="160"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  Optionally the function can store an alignment offset in the offset</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00161" /><CodeLine lineNumber="161"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  variable in case it performs alignment and the returned pointer is offset</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00162" /><CodeLine lineNumber="162"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  from the actual start of the memory region due to this alignment. The</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00163" /><CodeLine lineNumber="163"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  alignment offset will be passed to the memory unmap function. The</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00164" /><CodeLine lineNumber="164"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  alignment offset MUST NOT be larger than 65535 (storable in an uint16&#95;t),</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00165" /><CodeLine lineNumber="165"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  if it is you must use natural alignment to shift it into 16 bits. If you</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00166" /><CodeLine lineNumber="166"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  set a memory&#95;map function, you must also set a memory&#95;unmap function or</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00167" /><CodeLine lineNumber="167"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  else the default implementation will be used for both. This function must</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00168" /><CodeLine lineNumber="168"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  be thread safe, it can be called by multiple threads simultaneously.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00169" /><CodeLine lineNumber="169" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/rpmalloc-config-t/#adbcdb0bb951b75755ad9f6fa95c5fb89"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &#42;(&#42;memory&#95;map)(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">size&#95;t</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/nvptx/nvvmreflect-cpp/#ac934769d93af95250952646a3829df4c">size</a>, </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">size&#95;t</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &#42;offset);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00170" /><CodeLine lineNumber="170"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  //! Unmap the memory pages starting at address and spanning the given number</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00171" /><CodeLine lineNumber="171"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  //! of bytes.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00172" /><CodeLine lineNumber="172"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  If release is set to non-zero, the unmap is for an entire span range as</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00173" /><CodeLine lineNumber="173"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  returned by a previous call to memory&#95;map and that the entire range should</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00174" /><CodeLine lineNumber="174"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  be released. The release argument holds the size of the entire span range.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00175" /><CodeLine lineNumber="175"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  If release is set to 0, the unmap is a partial decommit of a subset of the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00176" /><CodeLine lineNumber="176"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  mapped memory range. If you set a memory&#95;unmap function, you must also set</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00177" /><CodeLine lineNumber="177"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  a memory&#95;map function or else the default implementation will be used for</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00178" /><CodeLine lineNumber="178"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  both. This function must be thread safe, it can be called by multiple</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00179" /><CodeLine lineNumber="179"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  threads simultaneously.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00180" /><CodeLine lineNumber="180" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/rpmalloc-config-t/#a10fb22a2f8775aafd70b1c79f6b80630"><span class="doxyHighlight">  void (&#42;<a href="/docs/api/structs/rpmalloc-config-t/#a10fb22a2f8775aafd70b1c79f6b80630">memory&#95;unmap</a>)(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &#42;address, </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">size&#95;t</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/nvptx/nvvmreflect-cpp/#ac934769d93af95250952646a3829df4c">size</a>, </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">size&#95;t</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> offset,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00181" /><CodeLine lineNumber="181"><span class="doxyHighlight">                       </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">size&#95;t</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> release);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00182" /><CodeLine lineNumber="182"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  //! Called when an assert fails, if asserts are enabled. Will use the standard</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00183" /><CodeLine lineNumber="183"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  //! assert()</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00184" /><CodeLine lineNumber="184"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  if this is not set.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00185" /><CodeLine lineNumber="185" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/rpmalloc-config-t/#a4bc0e407dff5707e6e199ba21f7afbc6"><span class="doxyHighlight">  void (&#42;<a href="/docs/api/structs/rpmalloc-config-t/#a4bc0e407dff5707e6e199ba21f7afbc6">error&#95;callback</a>)(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">char</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &#42;message);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00186" /><CodeLine lineNumber="186"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  //! Called when a call to map memory pages fails (out of memory). If this</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00187" /><CodeLine lineNumber="187"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  //! callback is</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00188" /><CodeLine lineNumber="188"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  not set or returns zero the library will return a null pointer in the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00189" /><CodeLine lineNumber="189"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  allocation call. If this callback returns non-zero the map call will be</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00190" /><CodeLine lineNumber="190"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  retried. The argument passed is the number of bytes that was requested in</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00191" /><CodeLine lineNumber="191"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  the map call. Only used if the default system memory map function is used</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00192" /><CodeLine lineNumber="192"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  (memory&#95;map callback is not set).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00193" /><CodeLine lineNumber="193" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/rpmalloc-config-t/#a35106c441d799201ae0c57068d539ca4"><span class="doxyHighlight">  int (&#42;<a href="/docs/api/structs/rpmalloc-config-t/#a35106c441d799201ae0c57068d539ca4">map&#95;fail&#95;callback</a>)(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">size&#95;t</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/nvptx/nvvmreflect-cpp/#ac934769d93af95250952646a3829df4c">size</a>);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00194" /><CodeLine lineNumber="194"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  //! Size of memory pages. The page size MUST be a power of two. All memory</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00195" /><CodeLine lineNumber="195"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  //! mapping</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00196" /><CodeLine lineNumber="196"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  requests to memory&#95;map will be made with size set to a multiple of the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00197" /><CodeLine lineNumber="197"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  page size. Used if RPMALLOC&#95;CONFIGURABLE is defined to 1, otherwise system</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00198" /><CodeLine lineNumber="198"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  page size is used.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00199" /><CodeLine lineNumber="199" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/rpmalloc-config-t/#adcf8dfc992b8b4a4e6cd72e213bf1035"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">size&#95;t</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/rpmalloc-config-t/#adcf8dfc992b8b4a4e6cd72e213bf1035">page&#95;size</a>;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00200" /><CodeLine lineNumber="200"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  //! Size of a span of memory blocks. MUST be a power of two, and in</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00201" /><CodeLine lineNumber="201"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  //! &#91;4096,262144&#93;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00202" /><CodeLine lineNumber="202"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  range (unless 0 - set to 0 to use the default span size). Used if</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00203" /><CodeLine lineNumber="203"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  RPMALLOC&#95;CONFIGURABLE is defined to 1</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00204" /><CodeLine lineNumber="204" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/rpmalloc-config-t/#ab730f9de6da78affe64497f859d6d345"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">size&#95;t</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/rpmalloc-config-t/#ab730f9de6da78affe64497f859d6d345">span&#95;size</a>;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00205" /><CodeLine lineNumber="205"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  //! Number of spans to map at each request to map new virtual memory blocks.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00206" /><CodeLine lineNumber="206"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  //! This can</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00207" /><CodeLine lineNumber="207"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  be used to minimize the system call overhead at the cost of virtual memory</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00208" /><CodeLine lineNumber="208"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  address space. The extra mapped pages will not be written until actually</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00209" /><CodeLine lineNumber="209"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  used, so physical committed memory should not be affected in the default</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00210" /><CodeLine lineNumber="210"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  implementation. Will be aligned to a multiple of spans that match memory</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00211" /><CodeLine lineNumber="211"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  page size in case of huge pages.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00212" /><CodeLine lineNumber="212" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/rpmalloc-config-t/#a84cfc60f2a133ca255a762778cc024c6"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">size&#95;t</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/rpmalloc-config-t/#a84cfc60f2a133ca255a762778cc024c6">span&#95;map&#95;count</a>;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00213" /><CodeLine lineNumber="213"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  //! Enable use of large/huge pages. If this flag is set to non-zero and page</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00214" /><CodeLine lineNumber="214"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  //! size is</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00215" /><CodeLine lineNumber="215"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  zero, the allocator will try to enable huge pages and auto detect the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00216" /><CodeLine lineNumber="216"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  configuration. If this is set to non-zero and page&#95;size is also non-zero,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00217" /><CodeLine lineNumber="217"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  the allocator will assume huge pages have been configured and enabled</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00218" /><CodeLine lineNumber="218"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  prior to initializing the allocator. For Windows, see</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00219" /><CodeLine lineNumber="219"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/desktop/memory/large-page-support</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00220" /><CodeLine lineNumber="220"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  For Linux, see https://www.kernel.org/doc/Documentation/vm/hugetlbpage.txt</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00221" /><CodeLine lineNumber="221" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/rpmalloc-config-t/#a9cfb1a2f571e8ebe68185b387f04260b"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">int</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/rpmalloc-config-t/#a9cfb1a2f571e8ebe68185b387f04260b">enable&#95;huge&#95;pages</a>;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00222" /><CodeLine lineNumber="222"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  //! Respectively allocated pages and huge allocated pages names for systems</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00223" /><CodeLine lineNumber="223"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  supporting it to be able to distinguish among anonymous regions.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00224" /><CodeLine lineNumber="224" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/rpmalloc-config-t/#a8b1c79b90f2b7f66d98690b1234ab8d8"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">char</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/structs/rpmalloc-config-t/#a8b1c79b90f2b7f66d98690b1234ab8d8">page&#95;name</a>;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00225" /><CodeLine lineNumber="225" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/rpmalloc-config-t/#aaaf26ab237ec708c05953e92ae93578f"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">char</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/structs/rpmalloc-config-t/#aaaf26ab237ec708c05953e92ae93578f">huge&#95;page&#95;name</a>;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00226" /><CodeLine lineNumber="226" lineLink="#afea1bd62321a935b2ce6e268c7bcaf10"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#125; <a href="/docs/api/structs/rpmalloc-config-t">rpmalloc&#95;config&#95;t</a>;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00263" /><CodeLine lineNumber="263"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//! Allocate a memory block of at least the given size</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00264" /><CodeLine lineNumber="264"><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="#a2d18f870b8bad81e931c8c0a01e3672b">RPMALLOC&#95;EXPORT</a> <a href="#a85561f3ac6a729bf480cdf706d6c75dc">RPMALLOC&#95;ALLOCATOR</a> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &#42;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00266" /><CodeLine lineNumber="266"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00267" /><CodeLine lineNumber="267"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//! Free the given memory block</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00337" /><CodeLine lineNumber="337"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//! Heap type</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00338" /><CodeLine lineNumber="338"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">typedef</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">struct </span><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/structs/heap-t">heap&#95;t</a> rpmalloc&#95;heap&#95;t;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00340" /><CodeLine lineNumber="340"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//! Acquire a new heap. Will reuse existing released heaps or allocate memory</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00341" /><CodeLine lineNumber="341"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//! for a new heap</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00342" /><CodeLine lineNumber="342"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  if none available. Heap API is implemented with the strict assumption that</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00343" /><CodeLine lineNumber="343"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  only one single thread will call heap functions for a given heap at any</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00344" /><CodeLine lineNumber="344"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  given time, no functions are thread safe.</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00346" /><CodeLine lineNumber="346"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00347" /><CodeLine lineNumber="347"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//! Release a heap (does NOT free the memory allocated by the heap, use</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00348" /><CodeLine lineNumber="348"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//! rpmalloc&#95;heap&#95;free&#95;all before destroying the heap).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00349" /><CodeLine lineNumber="349"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  Releasing a heap will enable it to be reused by other threads. Safe to pass</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00350" /><CodeLine lineNumber="350"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  a null pointer.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00351" /><CodeLine lineNumber="351"><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="#a2d18f870b8bad81e931c8c0a01e3672b">RPMALLOC&#95;EXPORT</a> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> rpmalloc&#95;heap&#95;release(rpmalloc&#95;heap&#95;t &#42;heap);</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00357" /><CodeLine lineNumber="357"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00358" /><CodeLine lineNumber="358"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//! Allocate a memory block of at least the given size using the given heap. The</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00359" /><CodeLine lineNumber="359"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//! returned</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00364" /><CodeLine lineNumber="364"><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="#a2d18f870b8bad81e931c8c0a01e3672b">RPMALLOC&#95;EXPORT</a> <a href="#a85561f3ac6a729bf480cdf706d6c75dc">RPMALLOC&#95;ALLOCATOR</a> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &#42;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00365" /><CodeLine lineNumber="365"><span class="doxyHighlight">rpmalloc&#95;heap&#95;aligned&#95;alloc(rpmalloc&#95;heap&#95;t &#42;heap, </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">size&#95;t</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> alignment,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00366" /><CodeLine lineNumber="366"><span class="doxyHighlight">                            </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">size&#95;t</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/nvptx/nvvmreflect-cpp/#ac934769d93af95250952646a3829df4c">size</a>) <a href="#aaec208006a1707aadcfb577cd0e05014">RPMALLOC&#95;ATTRIB&#95;MALLOC</a></span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00371" /><CodeLine lineNumber="371"><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="#a2d18f870b8bad81e931c8c0a01e3672b">RPMALLOC&#95;EXPORT</a> <a href="#a85561f3ac6a729bf480cdf706d6c75dc">RPMALLOC&#95;ALLOCATOR</a> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &#42;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00373" /><CodeLine lineNumber="373"><span class="doxyHighlight">                     </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">size&#95;t</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/nvptx/nvvmreflect-cpp/#ac934769d93af95250952646a3829df4c">size</a>) <a href="#aaec208006a1707aadcfb577cd0e05014">RPMALLOC&#95;ATTRIB&#95;MALLOC</a></span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00374" /><CodeLine lineNumber="374"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="#a5a97eca6d8747153e041a7acbdf2d2d4">RPMALLOC&#95;ATTRIB&#95;ALLOC&#95;SIZE2</a>(2, 3);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00375" /><CodeLine lineNumber="375"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00376" /><CodeLine lineNumber="376"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//! Allocate a memory block of at least the given size using the given heap and</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00377" /><CodeLine lineNumber="377"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//! zero initialize it. The returned</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00378" /><CodeLine lineNumber="378"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  block will have the requested alignment. Alignment must either be zero, or a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00379" /><CodeLine lineNumber="379"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  power of two and a multiple of sizeof(void&#42;), and should ideally be less</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00380" /><CodeLine lineNumber="380"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  than memory page size. A caveat of rpmalloc internals is that this must also</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00381" /><CodeLine lineNumber="381"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  be strictly less than the span size (default 64KiB).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00382" /><CodeLine lineNumber="382"><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="#a2d18f870b8bad81e931c8c0a01e3672b">RPMALLOC&#95;EXPORT</a> <a href="#a85561f3ac6a729bf480cdf706d6c75dc">RPMALLOC&#95;ALLOCATOR</a> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &#42;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00384" /><CodeLine lineNumber="384"><span class="doxyHighlight">                             </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">size&#95;t</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> num, </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">size&#95;t</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/nvptx/nvvmreflect-cpp/#ac934769d93af95250952646a3829df4c">size</a>) <a href="#aaec208006a1707aadcfb577cd0e05014">RPMALLOC&#95;ATTRIB&#95;MALLOC</a></span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00386" /><CodeLine lineNumber="386"></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00394" /><CodeLine lineNumber="394"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00395" /><CodeLine lineNumber="395"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//! Reallocate the given block to at least the given size. The memory block MUST</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00396" /><CodeLine lineNumber="396"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//! be allocated</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00397" /><CodeLine lineNumber="397"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  by the same heap given to this function. The returned block will have the</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00414" /><CodeLine lineNumber="414"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//! Set the given heap as the current heap for the calling thread. A heap MUST</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00416" /><CodeLine lineNumber="416"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  for a single thread, a heap can never be shared between multiple threads.</span></CodeLine>
